glsa.title: Poppler: Two buffer overflow vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Poppler is vulnerable to an integer overflow and a stack overflow.

background.p: Poppler is a cross-platform PDF rendering library originally based on Xpdf.

description.p: Poppler and Xpdf are vulnerable to an integer overflow in the StreamPredictor::StreamPredictor function, and a stack overflow in the StreamPredictor::getNextLine function. The original vulnerability was discovered by Maurycy Prodeus. Note: Gentoo's version of Xpdf is patched to use the Poppler library, so the update to Poppler will also fix Xpdf.

impact.p: By enticing a user to view a specially crafted program with a Poppler-based PDF viewer such as Gentoo's Xpdf, Epdfview, or Evince, a remote attacker could cause an overflow, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
